hackathon-description-text: Join us for the first ever HackGT@UPC, bringing together students from GeorgiaTech and the Facultat d’Informàtica de Barcelona. 24h of disrupting social accessibility in Barcelona with students, mentors and companies from all around the globe.
hackathon-eligibility: Only hackers who recieved a ticket and confirmed attendance are eligible to participate in HackGT@UPC. If you attended and hacked at HackGT@UPC, then you are eligible to make a submission.
hackathon-rules:
Only teams of eligible participants that submit their hacks to this Devpost, and then demo their hack, can win prizes. 
- 
- All code must be fresh, done during the hacking period (3:00 PM Thu 10:00 AM Fri)
- You cannot steal another team's source code
- The decision of judges is final

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
Creativity
Does the hack do something new? Is it mindblowing?
Does everything appear to work? Is it well designed? Is the user experience good?
How technically interesting or difficult is the hack? Were there geniune technical problems to overcome?
Is it something people would actually use? Does it fulfill a real need?

hackathon-description-header: Georgia Tech hacks UPC - Disrupt Social Accessibility
